page.title: 11LAND TRANSPORT IN NEWHAVEN
page.content: Travel to and from Newhaven is by both road and rail. Southdown is the local company which operates the bus service. This includes "Stage Coach" which is a service along the coast and "County Rider" which only caters for a maximum of thirty passengers and offers wheelchair facilities, serving the surrounding villages linking both Newhaven and Lewes. There are three railway stations in Newhaven. The Town station serves the general public: the Harbour station is mainly used by ferry passengers while the third station is used for cargo. The British Rail service links Newhaven with Seaford, Brighton and Lewes where passengers change for forward travel to London, the journey taking one hour fifteen minutes.
